meanings.definition: To cover with slime or slimy substance.
meanings.sent1: The snail will beslime the rock as it moves along.
meanings.sent2: I accidentally beslimed my hands while playing in the mud.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child tried to beslime his friend with gooey slime.
meanings.sent4: The monster in the movie would beslime its victims with a sticky substance.
meanings.sent5: The slimy creature would beslime everything in its path as it slithered along.

meanings.sent1: The stagnant water will beslime anything that touches it.
meanings.sent2: The spilled oil began to beslime the once clean floor.
meanings.sent3: The naughty puppy managed to beslime the entire room with its muddy paws.
meanings.sent4: The old book was beslimed with years of dust and grime.
meanings.sent5: The rainstorm would beslime the streets with a layer of mud and filth.

meanings.definition: Covered with slime or slimy substance.
meanings.sent1: The frog's skin felt beslime to the touch.
meanings.sent2: The sewer walls were beslime and slippery.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally dropped the fish into a beslime bucket of goo.
meanings.sent4: The haunted house was filled with beslime corridors that oozed mystery.
meanings.sent5: The swamp was a beslime environment where creatures lurked in the murky waters.
